auth.question: Which online sources do you trust?
auth.mainText: Source Checker is an online tool for lessons in which students vote on the credibility of real Internet content. A YouTube video, an Instagram post or an article from an unknown news site - which sources do young people trust and which do they trust less? Source checkers are a fun way to find out. The aim is to provide an easy introduction to the topic of information and news literacy and to examine the credibility of different internet sources.

input.incorrectType: Wrong character type - use digits only

footer.header: The source checker is a project by

chooseAction.header: What would you like to do?

newSurvey.labelTextOne: Should students have the option to choose their own user names? If this option is deactivated, students are automatically assigned numbers.
newSurvey.labelTextTwo: Should the names be displayed in the results shown to the students? If no, only the cumulative results are displayed.
newSurvey.ratingText: In this type of survey, students have to rate the given pages according to trustworthiness. This is done using a scale of 1 - 5 stars (not trustworthy - trustworthy)
newSurvey.warningText: The data cannot be changed later!

addPages.notiHeader: No pages have been added to this survey yet.
addPages.notiText: Add a link from any source to be able to start a survey.
